annotation.text: Sphingosine kinases and their metabolites modulate endolysosomal trafficking in photoreceptors
Sphingosine kinases and their metabolites modulate endolysosomal trafficking in photoreceptors

Gain- and loss-of-function analyses show that sphingosine kinases affect trafficking of the G protein-coupled receptor Rhodopsin and the light-sensitive transient receptor potential (TRP) channel by modulating the levels of dihydrosphingosine 1 phosphate (DHS1P) and sphingosine 1 phosphate (S1P).

Gain- and loss-of-function analyses show that sphingosine kinases affect trafficking of the G protein-coupled receptor Rhodopsin and the light-sensitive transient receptor potential (TRP) channel by modulating the levels of dihydrosphingosine 1 phosphate (DHS1P) and sphingosine 1 phosphate (S1P).

annotation.infon: endosome transport via multivesicular body sorting pathway|GO:0032509
annotation.text: In this study, gain- and loss-of-function analyses of Sk1 (Drosophila sphingosine kinase 1) and Sk2 sphingosine kinases in photoreceptors show that they modulate the endolysosomal trafficking of Rh1 and TRP.

annotation.infon: endosome transport via multivesicular body sorting pathway|GO:0032509
annotation.text: In this study, gain- and loss-of-function analyses of Sk1 (Drosophila sphingosine kinase 1) and Sk2 sphingosine kinases in photoreceptors show that they modulate the endolysosomal trafficking of Rh1 and TRP.
Expression of Sk2 leads to extensive photoreceptor degeneration: very few intact ommatidia are seen, rhabdomeres are lost, and cells are vacuolated.
Enhanced lysosomal degradation of Rh1 and TRP in Sk2 overexpressors
This shows that targeted overeexpression of Sk2 could induce degeneration after the development of photoreceptors (Fig. 1 E).

Sk2 shows cytoplasmic staining; additionally, we found that Sk2 can localize to lysosomal membranes, as seen by its colocalization with GFP-tagged Drosophila lysosome-associated membrane protein 1 (Lamp1), a lysosomal marker (Elwell and Engel, 2005).
Sk1 mutant shows trafficking defects and an altered DHS1P/S1P ratio
